text: Julienne David (1773-1843), was a French privateer. Julienne David participated in the Vendée Revolt on the royalists side and was imprisoned, but managed to escape sentence. After having secured a privateer's letter, she persecuted British ships on the English channel from her base in Nantes. In 1803, she was imprisoned in England for 8 years. After her release, she returned to France. A street in Nantes is named after her. She's also the subject of a novel. ==References == * Marie-Eve Sténuit, Femmes pirates: Les écumeuses des mers. Paris: Éditions du Trésor 2015. Category:French privateers Category:1773 births Category:1843 deaths Category:Women in 19th-century warfare Category:Female pirates Category:19th-century pirates
title: Julienne David
